where this directory should push to git. We then load the we are interested using the read.table and change direct

```{r}
counts_values_0h = read.table("counts_values_0h.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
counts_values_30min = read.table("counts_values_30min.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)
counts_values_6h = read.table("counts_values_6h.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE, row.names = 1)

```

We then need to select only the total counts from the files, which is done using the stringr programme, extract last word of each column, corresponding to the total count and replace in table

```{r}
library(stringr) 
# 
counts_values_0h_total = data.frame(str_extract(counts_values_0h[-1,]$ERR405224.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_0h[-1,]$ERR405225.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_0h[-1,]$ERR405226.sorted.bam, "\\w+$"))


counts_values_30min_total = data.frame(str_extract(counts_values_30min[-1,]$ERR405227.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_30min[-1,]$ERR405228.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_30min[-1,]$ERR405229.sorted.bam, "\\w+$"))

counts_values_6h_total = data.frame(str_extract(counts_values_6h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405230.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_6h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405231.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_6h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405232.sorted.bam, "\\w+$"))

counts_values_24h_total = data.frame(str_extract(counts_values_24h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405233.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_24h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405234.sorted.bam,"\\w+$"),
                                str_extract(counts_values_24h[-1,]$mapped_ERR405235.sorted.bam, "\\w+$"))

# the raw_0h[-1,] removes the row giving the "total" header for each column in 30 min sample
colnames(counts_values_0h_total) = colnames(counts_values_0h[1:3])
rownames(counts_values_0h_total) = rownames(counts_values_0h[-1,]) 
colnames(counts_values_30min_total) = colnames(counts_values_30min[1:3])
rownames(counts_values_30min_total) = rownames(counts_values_30min[-1,])
colnames(counts_values_6h_total) = colnames(counts_values_6h[1:3])
rownames(counts_values_6h_total) = rownames(counts_values_6h[-1,])
colnames(counts_values_24h_total) = colnames(counts_values_24h[1:3])
rownames(counts_values_24h_total) = rownames(counts_values_24h[-1,])

raw_counts_30min_0h = data.frame(counts_values_0h_total, counts_values_30min_total)
raw_counts_6h_0h = data.frame(counts_values_0h_total, counts_values_6h_total)
raw_counts_24h_0h = data.frame(counts_values_0h_total, counts_values_24h_total)
rm(counts_values_0h_total, counts_values_30min_total, counts_values_6h_total, counts_values_24h_total)
```
Downloading and running the the DESeq:

```{r}
if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
  install.packages("BiocManager")

BiocManager::install("DESeq")        
library('DESeq')
```

Following the installation, the DESeq analysis is run. To do so, we specify what columns correspond to a given condition, i.e. compare data from time 0 and time 0.5h samples;


```{r}
condition_30min = factor(c("0h","0h","0h","0.5h","0.5h","0.5h"))
condition_6h = factor(c("0h","0h","0h","6h","6h","6h"))
condition_24h = factor(c("0h","0h","0h","24h","24h","24h"))

#Check type of data in the raw counts table
sapply(raw_counts_30min_0h, class) # Is factor
# Transform into numeric instead of factor
class_transform = sapply(raw_counts_30min_0h, is.factor)
class_transform = sapply(raw_counts_6h_0h, is.factor)
class_transform = sapply(raw_counts_24h_0h, is.factor)
raw_counts_30min_0h[class_transform] <- lapply(raw_counts_30min_0h[class_transform ], function(x) as.numeric(as.character(x)))
raw_counts_6h_0h[class_transform] <- lapply(raw_counts_6h_0h[class_transform ], function(x) as.numeric(as.character(x)))
raw_counts_24h_0h[class_transform] <- lapply(raw_counts_24h_0h[class_transform ], function(x) as.numeric(as.character(x)))

sapply(raw_counts_30min_0h,class) # now factor



count_ds_30min = newCountDataSet(countData = raw_counts_30min_0h, condition_30min)
count_ds_6h = newCountDataSet(countData = raw_counts_6h_0h, condition_6h)
count_ds_24h = newCountDataSet(countData = raw_counts_24h_0h, condition_24h)

```

```{r}

#modelled_data = DESeq(modelled_data)
head(fData(count_ds_30min) )
result_30min = nbinomTest(count_ds_30min, "0h", "0.5h" ) # Calculate logFC + p 
result_30min = data.frame(result_30min, row.names = 1) # set gene names as row names in the results table

result_6h = nbinomTest(count_ds_6h, "0h", "6h" ) # Calculate logFC + p 
result_6h = data.frame(result_6h, row.names = 1) # set gene names as row names in the results table

result_24h = nbinomTest(count_ds_24h, "0h", "24h" ) # Calculate logFC + p 
result_24h = data.frame(result_24h, row.names = 1)
```


```{r}
# Order data and calculate how many have FDR < 0.05
# order by adjusted p-value
ordered.counts_30min = order(result_30min$padj,decreasing = FALSE)
ordered.counts_6h = order(result_6h$padj,decreasing = FALSE)
ordered.counts_24h = order(result_24h$padj,decreasing = FALSE)

# make new table
results.ordered_30min = result_30min[ordered.counts_30min,]
results.ordered_6h = result_6h[ordered.counts_6h,]
results.ordered_24h = result_24h[ordered.counts_24h,]

#extract significant
significant_genes_30min = subset(results.ordered_30min,results.ordered_30min$padj<0.05) # total of 305...
significant_genes_6h = subset(results.ordered_6h,results.ordered_6h$padj<0.05)
# 1789
significant_genes_24h = subset(results.ordered_24h,results.ordered_24h$padj<0.05)
# 1020
```
